question: Question_02_(b)
statement:
Question: Let u1 = $\begin{bmatrix}
0\\ 
2\\
1\\
2 
\end{bmatrix}$, u2 = $\begin{bmatrix}
1\\ 
-2\\
0\\
2 
\end{bmatrix}$, u3 = $\begin{bmatrix}
2\\ 
0\\
2\\
-1 
\end{bmatrix}$ Express v = $\begin{bmatrix}
3\\ 
-4\\
1\\
-1 
\end{bmatrix}$ as a linear combination of the ui.
sols:
To do this, we can set up u1, u2, u3 and v as a matrix equation and
solve for the coefficients a1, a2, a3 that produce v.

M = $\begin{bmatrix}
u1 & u2 & u3 
\end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix}
0 & 1 & 2\\ 
2 & -2 & 0\\
1 & 0 & 2\\
2 & 2 & -1 
\end{bmatrix}$M * a = v

Solving this equation, a = $\begin{bmatrix}
-1 & 1 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$

So, v = u2 + u3 - u1
